A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It is awful to watch for any older fans. If you grew up with the saga\, and invested any emotional attachment to the franchise\, then no doubt you already felt double-crossed by Disney/Lucasfilm when TFA was released. This latest instalment seems to be actively trolling the real fan base. When I consider my associates who vaunted accolades upon this movie\, it has become crystal clear why certain choices were made regarding TLJ plot and characters. This movie is a backlash at the regular Star Wars Joe and Jane. It pushes a millennial attitude agenda so far up your rectum it is truly embarrassing to watch. Watching the poor sap sat near you fawning over hollow platitudes\, thinly veiled as 'plot' is saddening indeed. The director\, whilst dismantling as much as he can of the original atmosphere of Star Wars instalments\, seems to be shooting a parody and roast of it's subject and characters\, the Y2K generation\, and all expectations of fan service.\nIt will be remembered as the weakest of all Star Wars movies\, which could have delivered so much more but instead elected to be vacuous\, nonsensical and appease the small minority of fans that are part of the progressive social cancer in both Hollywood and the general public.
